column1: Smoque BBQ////My husband and I each had the brisket
column2: and it beats just about any other brisket I've had.  I'm from Kentucky...land of the Moonlite B-B-Q Inn (world famous barbecue joint)
column3: so I know barbecue when I have it.  Portions were generous
column5: and the atmosphere was friendly.  Beware of the "family style" tables in the tiny restaurant
column6: though.  We got there around 6:30 on a Friday for dinner
column7: and a line began to form soon after--so go early.
